title: Textile, "American Liberty", 1783–89
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved plate on plain weave foundation.
inscribed: In one medallion," non sine diis animosus infans, 1777 oct. 17, 1781 oct. 19" and in the other, "Libertas americana, 4 juillet 1776".
dimensions:
A. Warp: 105.5 cm (41 1/2 in.). Weft: 92.5 cm (36 1/2 in.) Both selvedges present. 
B. Warp: 57.5 cm (22 3/4 in.). Weft: 47 cm (18 1/2 in.). Part of right selvedge present.
Pattern: height of repeat: 96 cm (37 3/4 in.).
description: Two rural scenes in vertical alignment separated by swags with monkeys and animals with two circular medallions showing Minerva (France) protecting the infant Hercules (America) form an attacking leopard (England) in one and the head of a revolutionary. In red on white.
